customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but not very good if you need really accurate 45 degree cuts
customer_reviews.text: If you only need to cut lumber for construction or handyman type work, this saw would likely work fine for you. But if you need really accurate 45 degree cuts - such as for making picture frames - this in not the saw for you. Manufacturer tolerances are sloppy, not tight... when setting the saw to 45 degrees, it's supposed to snap into that angle and stay there - this saw sort of does that, but with a fair bit of play at the 45 degree setting.
customer_reviews.author: BobD

customer_reviews.title: Straight even cuts, good power, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this saw to cut small width wood, 2x4's, and bamboo for crafts. I've had no problems with staight line and angle cuts except cutting 2x4's at a 90 degree angle. It will not saw all the way through at this angle so I have to flip the wood and realign the saw. This miter saw is easy to handle and has good power. Cuts with ease. Great price. The sawdust/chip bag, on the other hand, never stays secure enough so I end up with a work table full of sawdust.
customer_reviews.author: JoLa

customer_reviews.title: BURNED UP AFTER 5 HOURS
customer_reviews.text: Lucky us! We purchased the extended warranty. My German husband has logged in the Black Forest and has been cutting firewood here in the US since he was 10-12 years old. Which is to say he knows about using saws. He mounted this saw on a sturdy table and began cutting up old 2 x 4s for firewood. The saw sparked and then burned up the brushes after 5 hours. We will be contacting the warranty company now. I will update this review, if possible, to report our experience with the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: L. M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Lack of replacement parts availability. Throwaway saw?
customer_reviews.text: I’ve enjoyed using this saw for small projects up to this point. However, parts availability seems to be lacking. B&Ds own website says to order parts off the diagram and when the diagram link is pressed it says “not available”. Any other parts website does not list this saw. The part in question is the blade bolt and it immediately snapped when I tried to remove it for the first time. Admittedly I tried to turn it the wrong way but it sure snapped off easily. Hopefully parts availability will improve but until then I’d stay away.

product_meta.title: Black+Decker M1850BD 7-1/4" Compound Miter Saw,
product_meta.description: The BLACK + DECKER 7-1/4" compound offers a lightweight, portable saw that provides accurate cutting of trim, framing and craft projects. Idea for crown and base molding jobs around the house or jobsite. The 9.0 amp ball bearing motor provides the power to cut up to 2" x 4" (dimensional) at 90° and 2" x 3" (dimensional) at 45°. the saw has nine positive stops at the most used miter angles with a range of 0-45° left and right. The saw head tilts to the left up to 45° for bevel and compound cut angles.
feature_bullets: Compact, portable saw for cutting accuracy
Idea for Crown and base molding jobs
Use for trim, framing and craft projects
Miter range 0-45° left and right, with nine positive stops
Die-cast aluminum construction for an overall weight of under 17 pounds
